abstract: Behind the reports was a sober reality: Those robust profits were driven by billions of dollars in one-time gains.
snippet: Behind the reports was a sober reality: Those robust profits were driven by billions of dollars in one-time gains.
lead_paragraph: The problems at the nation’s big banks have caused trouble for many ordinary Americans. But increasingly, it is the problems of ordinary Americans that are causing trouble for the big banks.

headline.main: Citigroup and BofA Profits Aided by Asset Sales
headline.print_headline: Profits at Two Banks Mask Signs of More Trouble Ahead

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Live blogging results from Bank of America and Citigroup. At B of A, losses vanish with extraordinary gains.
snippet: Live blogging results from Bank of America and Citigroup. At B of A, losses vanish with extraordinary gains.
lead_paragraph: This is the day that Bank of America and Citigroup, who seem like pitiful helpless giants, to use Richard Nixon’s phrase, report on second-quarter results. Both banks have been subjected to leaks indicating regulators want management and board changes. The newest posts are at the top.

abstract: Bank of America said Friday that it earned $3.2 billion in the second quarter, as higher mortgage banking income, trading profits and gains from an asset sale offset mounting loan losses.
snippet: Bank of America said Friday that it earned $3.2 billion in the second quarter, as higher mortgage banking income, trading profits and gains from an asset sale offset mounting loan losses.
lead_paragraph: Update | 9:52 a.m. Bank of America and Citigroup, giants that have come to symbolize the troubles plaguing the nation’s banking industry, announced Friday that they were once again turning handsome profits.

headline.main: Asset Sales Lift Citi and BofA to Profit

abstract: Floyd Norris comments on the earnings announcements and conference calls by Bank of America and Citigroup.
snippet: Floyd Norris comments on the earnings announcements and conference calls by Bank of America and Citigroup.
lead_paragraph: From Floyd Norris’s blog, Notions on High and Low Finance:
